Text:
Right then, everyone, let's sum up our intelligence
reports on the Templars.

A general analysis of the Jugang Ruins investigation
and the additional intel from the cathedral shows...

The Templars are an organization within the Church
in charge of the Inquisition, based out of the the Sacred
State Orum.

It seems quite evident that details of their work
differ from the Cult's, despite resemblances.

They are a de facto execution squad that kill anyone
labeled a heretic, including the possessed, eliminating
them in the name of their goddess.

In other words, their approach to the possessed is
different from that of the Cult of Diablos.

The Cult gathers the possessed from the Church and
uses them as internal experimental subjects.

The Templars, however, stand in the way of this work
that the Church and Cult are doing.

This means that within the larger Church
organization, there is a conflict between
the Templars and the faction working
with the Cult.

This conflict also manifests in logistics as each side
seeks to stop the other from being able to intercept
their own flow of supplies and the possessed.

This means the relationship between the Cult and
Templars is kept within the Church, but is still
incredibly dangerous.

The Cult seeks to manipulate the world from the
shadows, so a group like the Templars has value
as a tool, but is also a thorn in its side.

To the Templars, since the Cult keeps the possessed
alive, it is essentially a heretical organization.
That would imply we have an opportunity here.

We could lure each side out with the promise of
intel on their opponent.

So, we have the Cult that gathers the possessed from
all over the world for experiments.

And the Templars, who execute the possessed on sight.
Which is the greater threat to the Garden?

There's not much difference in priority. But I don't
think we can round them all up at once.

If we try to rush a task like this, we'll likely just
end up making more work for ourselves.
I'm with Beta. A war on two fronts is bad strategy.
Why are you so sure of that, Gamma?

Whatever the working relationship, we can view the
Templars as subordinate to the Cult.

The Cult has been gathering the possessed under
Church orders, and then the Templars came along
and butted in.

I'm not sure this analogy fits, but from the Cult's
perspective, the Templars are like a bull in a china
shop.

In which case, on a simply structural basis, I think
we should start by taking out the Templars.

That might actually end up benefiting the Cult
of Diablos, though.

There is that. The Garden really isn't interested in
unintentionally helping an enemy...

Unfortunately, it's a shame but there is a real
possibility of that.

I'm sure the Cult would love to have the Templars'
right of inquisition.

If the Cult took over the Church's inquisition...
I barely even want to imagine it.

The right of inquisition can even be invoked against
a kingdoms. It could make the whole world an enemy
of the Church.

In other words, the huge power it represents keeps
balance between the Cult and the Templars.

If they weren't killing the possessed, the Templars
might even be a welcome force keeping the
Cult in check.

Things hardly ever go just the way you want
in battle.

And there is one thing that we must never forget in
our work as the Shadow Garden.
